alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Chattooga; Dade; Walker; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 6:31PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Catoosa, Whitfield, Walker, south central Dade and Chattooga Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 631 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Indian Springs to Noble to Desoto State Park, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Dalton, Lafayette, Summerville, Ringgold, Fort Oglethorpe, Chickamauga, Trion, Varnell, Tunnel Hill, Cohutta, La Fayette, Menlo, Center Post, Subligna, Blue Spring, Linwood, Beaverdale, Villanow, Cloudland, and James H. Floyd State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
